issues.title: Martin Durst feedback.
issues.author: richsalz
issues.body:
Hello Rich, others,

Just a few comments:

- I personally don't like draft names such as XXXX-update (with XXXX
being an RFC number). There are people in the IETF that know all their
RFCs by number, but others don't. Such draft names may be okay if the
document has a more descriptive title. So please at least use a more
descriptive title.

- RFC 8717 is so short that an update doesn't make sense. It looks like
you got to the same conclusion, as draft-rsalz-8717-update-00.txt says
"Updates: 3710, 3929, 4633, 6702, 9281 (if approved)", without
mentioning RFC 8717. Also, the abstract, towards the end, says "updates
the source documents". It would be good if this were reflected in the
title and even better if it were also reflected in the draft name
(e.g. draft-rsalz-8717-replacement). Also, at the top, the draft should
say "Obsoletes: 8717 (if approved)".

- As a result of the above two comments, a better title may be
   "Replacement of RFC 8717 to remove the Managing Director of the IETF
Secretariat" or so. But that title, while suited for the start, won't
look particularly good when this is published as an RFC. For that, I'd
aim for something like "IETF Administrative Support Activity 2.0:
Consolidated Updates to IETF Administrative Terminology 2.0".

- The abstract contains a grammatical error:
   "so that the job to done" -> "so that the job to be done"

(I have to admit that I haven't yet read the draft itself, sorry.)

Regards,   Martin.
